availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry Crutcher Wood (Hart County, Kentucky, representative, attorney, and Court of Appeals Justice)

body.p:
Jefferson County, Kentucky, representative, attorney, and Court of Appeals justice. Hart County, Kentucky, native. Son of George Twyman Wood and Elizabeth Helm Wood. Married to Elizabeth Barret Wood in Green County, Kentucky, on January 1, 1843. Father of Henry Crittenden Wood, Thomas John Wood, George Twyman Wood, and Lizzie Boyle Wood.
Graduate of Centre College in Boyle County, Kentucky, in 1841. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Hart County from 1847 to 1848. Attorney in Hart County in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Hart County in 1850. Justice of the Kentucky Court of Appeals from 1858 to 1861. Owned ten enslaved persons in Louisville in 1860. Died in Hart County on February 11, 1861.
